node.title: 'We're behind you': Ex-All Blacks rally behind under-12s player bullied for weight
node.description: Jerome Kaino, Julian Savea and Israel Dagg are among those to lend support to a boy criticised for being too big.
node.content: ["The rugby community has rallied around a Welsh under-12s player bullied for his weight and told he was \"too big\" to play with his teammates.", "On Monday (NZ time), Mark Pugsley tweeted that he'd had to remove a post from his personal Facebook page about his son Alfie playing rugby, due to negative comments directed at the under-12s player.", "\"Had to remove a post from Facebook as an idiot commented saying my boy is too 'big' to play under-12s and isn't healthy,\" Pugsley wrote.", "\"If only people knew how hard he works to get fitter and how low his confidence has been. Don't worry Alfie, I'll always be your biggest fan.\"", "But as Pugsley's tweet went viral, reaction from some of the game's biggest names has seen Alfie inundated with support and encouragement - and even earn an invitation to attend the English Premiership final at Twickenham in June.", "Former All Blacks were among those to support Alfie, with Julian Savea saying \"Keep chasing your dreams Alfie\" in response.", "\"Hey Alfie, you keep having loads of fun & working hard mate,\" replied Jerome Kaino.\u00a0", "\"Our beautiful game is for ALL genders, people from ALL walks of life & also ALL shapes & sizes, keep that smile on your face brother & keep up the awesome work.\"", "\"You've another fan in all the way in New Zealand Alfie keep up the great work brother,\" added Israel Dagg.", "\"Big fella you have my support,\" wrote South Africa prop Tendai Mtawarira. \"I walked this road too once upon a time when people silently bullied me about my size and questioned whether I was the correct age for my age group.\u00a0", "\"Keep your head high and never let the haters get to you. The game of rugby is for all.\"\u00a0", "\"Alfie, we're behind you,\" France Rugby's official account replied.", "\"Be proud of who you are, because you're amazing. Be proud to have the most wonderful dad in the world. Don't forget that, whoever you are, or where you come from, we'll welcome you. Because rugby is for everyone. We love you.\""]
